The video was posted on a Facebook page: 2019, and has been viewed over 154,000 times and shared more than 8,700 times.
The caption of the post: translated from Bengali to English, states that despite the curfew in Kashmir, a large gathering of people has taken place and expresses hope for victory.
The video shows a man shouting anti: India slogans and words like "Azadi" (freedom) repeatedly, while a large crowd can be seen and heard expressing their desire for freedom from India.
Through a reverse image search: it was discovered that the video had been edited from a longer video published on YouTube in 2016, which showed a Muslim cleric delivering a speech after the death of a Kashmiri separatist group commander.
